metadata.Title: CVE-2014-125005 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, was found in FFmpeg 2.0. This affects the function decode_vol_header of the file libavcodec/mpeg4videodec.c. The manipulation leads to memory corruption. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-125005` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.2-2
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.2-2
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.2-2
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.2-2
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.2-2').
